(season 5)|Season 5]] | next_season = [[American Dad! (season 7)|Season 7]]{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/02/23/fox-renews-american-dad-for-a-seventh-season/83513|title=Fox Renews 'American Dad' for a Seventh Season|author=Robert Seidman|publisher=TV by the Numbers}}{{Cite web|url=http://www.tvline.com/2011/02/breaking-fox-renews-american-dad|title=Breaking: Fox Renews American Dad|publisher=TVLine}} | episode_list = [[List of American Dad! episodes|List of ''American Dad!'' episodes]] }} '''''[[American Dad!]]''''''s sixth season began airing on October 3, 2010. and ended after 19 episodes on May 22, 2011. Guest stars of this season include [[Jason Alexander]], [[Sarah Chalke]], [[Hector Elizondo]], [[Anthony Michael Hall]], [[Hayden Panettiere]], [[Lou Diamond Phillips]] and [[Burt Reynolds]]. ==Episodes== {{see also|List of American Dad! episodes}} {| class="wikitable" width="100%" |- style="color:white" ! style="background:#FF6666; color:#FFFFFF;"| No. in

code ! style="background:#FF6666; color:#FFFFFF;"| U.S. viewers
(million) {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[100 A.D.]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|10|3}} | DirectedBy = Tim Parsons | WrittenBy = Keith Heisler | ProdCode = 5AJN14 | Aux4 = 6.16{{cite web |url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/10/05/sunday-finals-the-simpsons-family-guy-american-dad-amazing-race-desperate-housewives-rise-undercover-boss-a-bit-less-bossy-vs-football/66787 |title=Sunday Finals: The Simpsons, Family Guy, American Dad, Amazing Race, Desperate Housewives Rise; Undercover Boss A Bit Less Bossy vs. Football |first=Robert |last=Seidman |date=October 5, 2010 |accessdate=March 27, 2011 |work=TV by the Numbers}} | EpisodeNumber = 97 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | ShortSummary = Jeff continues to try to get Hayley back until Stan and Francine confront him and tells him to leave her alone. Taking Reginald's advice to give Hayley some space, Jeff decides to confront Hayley once and for all. It is later revealed that Jeff and Hayley eloped, and Stan and Francine offers the public a reward to stop the wedding, an amount of $50,000. Later on, they are eventually found, and Stan and Francine are tricked by Jeff into giving him the 50 Grand, thus letting Stan allow them to get married. Meanwhile, in response of Jeff and Hayley's marriage announcement, Roger and Steve dress up as Wheels and the Legman (from the episode [[American Dad! (season 3)|Haylias]]) and try to stop the wedding and get the reward themselves, until Roger is under the influence of turkish amphetamines, landing them in Thailand. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[Son of Stan]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|10|10}} | DirectedBy = Chris Bennett | WrittenBy = Erik Sommers | ProdCode = 5AJN17 | Aux4 = 5.36{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/10/12/sunday-finals-housewives-adjusted-up-brothers-plus-final-cbs-ratings/67694|title=Sunday Finals: ''Housewives'' Adjusted Up; ''Brothers & Sisters'' Adjusted Down; Plus Final CBS Ratings|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Gorman|first=Bill|date=October 12, 2010|accessdate=October 13, 2010}} | EpisodeNumber = 98 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | ShortSummary = During a memorial service for the 97 people killed in the bus crash, Francine and Stan have a clash over how to raise Steve in retrospect to Hayley running away. Francine wishes to be more lenient, but Stan is convinced that they need to be firm with him. They decide to have a BMX race to determine how to raise Steve. Stan falls down and severely injures himself at the start of the race, making Francine the winner. However, Stan creates a clone of Steve (after being inspired by Duper's clone after the real Duper died in a bus crash last episode), setting up a new contest with Francine to determine who has better parenting skills. Francine raises the original Steve very passively, but Stan raises Steve's clone, Steve-A-Rino very strict and manly. However, Steve-A-Rino later becomes a [[sociopath]] due to Stan's strict training and attempts to kill the original Steve in hopes of replacing him, forcing Stan and Francine to find the real Steve and stop his murderous clone before it's too late. In the end, Steve is found and Steve-a-rino is shot. Meanwhile, Roger selfishly decides to go after Haley and Jeff to steal the money they tricked Stan into giving them for his own idiotic ideas. When they refuse to give him the money, Roger begins making an annoying noise; they flee via helicopter to a private boat, only to find he is the captain. They flee again. Finally confronting them at the Great Wall of China, the dumbass finds that Haley and Jeff have being using their money get the hell away from him, making his victory a rather hollow one as there was only a few hundred left. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[Best Little Horror House in Langley Falls]] | RTitle = | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|11|7}} | DirectedBy = John Aoshima & Jansen Yee | WrittenBy = Eric Weinberg | ProdCode = 5AJN19 | Aux4 = 6.30{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.com/2010/11/09/sunday-finals-desperate-housewives-adjusted-up-brothers-sisters-cleveland-show-adjusted-down-plus-final-cbs-nbc-numbers/71366|title=Sunday Finals: â''Desperate Housewives''â Adjusted Up; â''Brothers & Sisters'',â â''Cleveland Show''â Down, Plus Final CBS, NBC Numbers|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Gorman|first=Bill|date=November 9, 2010|accessdate=November 10, 2010}} | EpisodeNumber = 99 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | ShortSummary = After years of hosting the scariest haunted house in the neighborhood, Stan finds himself outdone by Buckle. Francine makes things worse when she finds herself returning and declares that it is impossible to beat him. Depressed, Stan goes to Roger for advice and Roger suggests he use his CIA influence to get real body parts and instruments. Stan decides to pull in five of the most dangerous serial murderers in the area. However, the killers sitting in their cell fails to scare anyone so Roger decides to turn them loose, forcing Stan, Francine, Roger and Klaus to take cover in the kitchen. Stan apologizes for getting them into the mess and Francine admits she should have been more supportive. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[Stanâs Food Restaurant]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|11|14}} | DirectedBy = Josue Cervantes | WrittenBy = Brian Boyle | ProdCode = 5AJN16 | Aux4 = 5.38{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/11/16/sunday-final-ratings-desperate-housewives-family-guy-amazing-race-adjusted-up-csi-miami-american-dad-60-minutes-down/72304|title=Sunday Final Ratings: â''Desperate Housewives''â,' â''Family Guy''â, â''Amazing Race''â Adjusted Up; â''CSI: Miami''â, â''American Dad''â, â''60 Minutes''â Down|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=November 16, 2010|accessdate=November 17, 2010}} | EpisodeNumber = 100 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | ShortSummary = Roger offers to help Stan live out his dream of opening a restaurant until their difference in vision for what the eatery should be causes havoc. It ends up with Stan getting cut of the project and opening his own restaurant next to Roger's. Stan puts Roger's restaurant out of business, causing Roger to blow up both of their restaurants. Meanwhile, A girl named Ashley ([[Hayden Pantierre]]), who got kicked out of a school for having too much sex, invites Steve and Snot over to her house. Trouble ensues when Ashley mistakingly accuses Snot of raping her doll, Julia, causing her to put off having sex. Steve and Snot write a suicide note, but Ashley found out Julia was murdered, causing her to put off having sex again. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[White Rice (American Dad!)|White Rice]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|11|21}} | DirectedBy = Bob Bowen | WrittenBy = Rick Wiener & Kenny Schwartz | ProdCode = 5AJN15 | Aux4 = 4.86{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/11/23/sunday-final-ratings-including-amazing-race-undercover-boss-and-csi-miami/73196|title=Sunday Final Ratings Including ''Amazing Race'', ''Undercover Boss'', and ''CSI: Miami''|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=November 23, 2010|accessdate=November 24, 2010}} | EpisodeNumber = 101 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | ShortSummary = After an argument between Stan and Francine breaks out, Stan suggests they go see a counselor named Sal ([[Jason Alexander]]), who turns out to be a hypnotist Stan has been using for years to settle arguments by repressing her memories. After feeling slighted by Stan, who walks out to get a sandwich by the time he asked Stan for one, Sal makes Francine remember everything, including her old desire to be a stand-up comedian and that Haley had a twin sister who died due to Stan refusing to pay for vaccinations. Stan ends up living alone when Francine is offered the chance to have a television show based on her life made; however, it is canceled due to racist jokes. Stan learns his lesson about not talking to Francine and agrees that the idea of moving her foster parents to their town is a bad idea, seeing that talking about their problems is not as bad as he thought. Meanwhile, Steve brings home a female fish to keep Klaus company. However, after having children with the fish, Klaus finds he detests her due to her eating their offspring, burying her alive in the yard. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[There Will Be Bad Blood]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|11|28}} | DirectedBy = [[Joe Daniello]] | WrittenBy = Murray Miller & Judah Miller | ProdCode = 5AJN20 | Aux4 = 6.13{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/11/30/sunday-final-ratings-amazing-race-adjusted-up-60-minutes-down-plus-chargerscolts/73851|title=Sunday Final Ratings: â''Amazing Race''â Adjusted Up; â''60 Minutes''â Down; Plus Chargers/Colts|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Gorman|first=Bill|date=November 30, 2010|accessdate=December 1, 2010}} | EpisodeNumber = 102 | EpisodeNumber2 = 6 | ShortSummary =The Smiths prepare for the arrival of Stan's half-brother, Rusty's ([[Lou Diamond Phillips]]) family for Thanksgiving. However, it gets subdued because of Steve's brattiness following Haley and Jeff's eloping. They decide to go to Rusty's to see what their home is like. However, it is revealed that Rusty is rich after discovering copper from a land given from his grandfather ([[Ed Asner]]). The Smiths try to pull the old switcheroo on Rusty, resulting in getting trapped in the desert. However, they are saved by Haley and Jeff. In the end, Stan lets Haley and Jeff move into their home after what they'd done. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[The People vs. Martin Sugar]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|12|05}} | DirectedBy = Pam Cooke | WrittenBy = Jonathan Fener | ProdCode = 5AJN05 | Aux4 = 5.31{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/12/07/sunday-final-ratings-desperate-housewives-60-minutes-amazing-race-adjusted-up-brothers-plus-steelersravens/74613|title=Sunday Final Ratings: â''Desperate Housewives,''â â''60 Minutes,''â â''Amazing Race''â Adjusted Up; â''Brothers & Sisters''â Down; Plus Steelers/Ravens|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Gorman|first=Bill|date=December 7, 2010|accessdate=December 8, 2010}} | EpisodeNumber = 103 | EpisodeNumber2 = 7 | ShortSummary =Stan Smith anxiously awaits his annual jury summons. But when Roger is the defendant in the trial where Stan is the foreman, he is finally in a position to make Roger accountable for his misdeeds. Roger gets the last laugh when he escapes from prison. Meanwhile, Jeff and Hayley move in with the Smiths, and Francine tries (and fails) to get Jeff to clean up his act due to him needing to be stoned in order to keep his libido in check. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[For Whom the Sleigh Bell Tolls]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2010|12|12}} | DirectedBy = Bob Bowen | WrittenBy = Erik Durbin | ProdCode = 5AJN22 | Aux4 = 6.22{{Cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/12/14/sunday-final-ratings-desperate-housewives-adjusted-up-the-simpsons-down-plus-amazing-race-undercover-boss-and-csi-miami/75412|title=Sunday Final Ratings: â''Desperate Housewives,'' Adjusted Up; â''The Simpsons,''â Down; Plus 'Amazing Race,' 'Undercover Boss,' and 'CSI: Miami'|work=TV by the Numbers|last=Seidman|first=Robert|date=December 14, 2010|accessdate=December 15, 2010}} | EpisodeNumber = 104 | EpisodeNumber2 = 8 | ShortSummary = Stan gives Steve a gun for Christmas, even though Francine warns him that Steve is too young. Steve accidentally shoots Santa, he sends the North Pole into a tizzy and jeopardizes Christmas, triggering a massive gunfight between the Smiths themselves and all the elfs and raindeer from the North Pole with Santa Claus himself leading the charge. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[Fart-Break Hotel]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|1|16}} | DirectedBy = Rodney Clouden | WrittenBy = Chris McKenna & Matt McKenna | ProdCode = 5AJN18 | Aux4 = 3.54{{cite web|last=Gorman|first=Bill|title=Sunday Final Ratings: â''Brothers & Sisters,'' â''Bob's Burgers'' Adjusted Down; Plus â''Golden Globes,'' â''Undercover Boss,'' â''CSI:Miami'' & More|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/01/19/sunday-final-ratings-brothers-plus-golden-globes-undercover-boss-csimiami-more/79343|work=TV By the Numbers|accessdate=January 19, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 105 | EpisodeNumber2 = 9 | ShortSummary = After Roger releases lethal gas into the Smith residence, the family moves into a hotel while the fumes clear. Francine finds herself with a lot of free time on her hands, and she soon finds herself working in the construction business. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[Stanny Boy and Frantastic]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|1|23}} | DirectedBy = Pam Cooke | WrittenBy = Laura McCreary | ProdCode = 5AJN13 | Aux4 = 4.81{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|title=Sunday Final Ratings: â''American Dad'' Adjusted Up; â''The Simpsons,'' â''Cleveland Show'' Adjusted Down |url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/01/25/sunday-final-ratings-american-dad-adjusted-up-the-simpsons-cleveland-show-adjusted-down/80137 |work=TV By the Numbers |accessdate=January 25, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 106 | EpisodeNumber2 = 10 | ShortSummary = Finding that they have no friends that like the both of them, Stan and Francine steal tickets to a show from Haley and unintentionally make friends with a younger couple. Soon, their (highly dangerous) life style proves too much for Stan and Francine; they sabotage their birth control products to force them into being less active. However, this causes the couple to break up and reconcile their differences once Stan and Francine reveal the truth to them, losing their friends. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[A PiÃ±ata Named Desire]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|2|13}} | DirectedBy = Bob Bowen | WrittenBy = Chris McKenna & Matt McKenna | ProdCode = 5AJN07 | Aux4 = 3.93{{cite web|last=Gorman|first=Bill|title=Sunday Final Ratings: 'Desperate Housewives,' 'America's Funniest Home Videos,' 'Dateline' Adjusted Up; 'Brothers & Sisters,' 'Simpsons' Down|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/02/15/sunday-final-ratings-desperate-housewives-americas-funniest-home-videos-dateline-adjusted-up-brothers-sisters-simpsons-down/82731|work=TV By the Numbers|accessdate=February 15, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 107 | EpisodeNumber2 = 11 | ShortSummary = Roger asks Stan to attend an acting class, but tempers flare when they audition for the same role. Meanwhile, Steve and his friends try to plan the ultimate slumber party. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[You Debt Your Life]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|2|20}} | DirectedBy = Chris Bennett | WrittenBy = Erik Sommers | ProdCode = 5AJN09 | Aux4 = 4.25{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/02/23/sunday-final-ratings-amazing-race-adjusted-up-the-simpsons-adjusted-down/83523|title=Sunday Final Ratings: 'Amazing Race' Adjusted Up; 'The Simpsons' Adjusted Down|work=TV by the Numbers|accessdate=February 23, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 108 | EpisodeNumber2 = 12 | ShortSummary = Roger moves out of the house after an argument with Stan and is quickly replaced; Steve gets a new job at school. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[I Am the Walrus (American Dad!)|I Am the Walrus]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|3|27}} | DirectedBy = Tim Parsons | WrittenBy = Keith Heisler | ProdCode = 5AJN21 | Aux4 = 4.99{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/03/29/sunday-final-ratings-finals-for-60-minutes-amazing-race-undercover-boss-csimiami-but-no-other-adjustments/87549|title=Sunday Final Ratings: Finals For '60 Minutes,' 'Amazing Race,' 'Undercover Boss,' 'CSI:Miami,' But No Other Adjustments|last=Gorman|first=Bill|work=TV by the Numbers|date=March 29, 2011|accessdate=March 29, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 109 | EpisodeNumber2 = 13 | ShortSummary = Steve challenges Stan for family dominance. Meanwhile, Jeff and Hayley try marriage counseling. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[School Lies]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|4|3}} | DirectedBy = Rodney Clouden | WrittenBy = Brian Boyle | ProdCode = 6AJN03 | Aux4 = 3.59{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/04/05/sunday-final-ratings-desperate-housewives-secret-millionaire-american-dad-celebrity-apprentice-adjusted-up-cleveland-down/88298|title=Sunday Final Ratings: "Desperate Housewives," "Secret Millionaire," "American Dad," "Celebrity Apprentice" Adjusted Up; "Cleveland" Down|last=Seidman|first=Robert|work=TV by the Numbers|date=April 5, 2011|accessdate=April 5, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 110 | EpisodeNumber2 = 14 | ShortSummary = Stan arranges a plan to get a raise through a favor of U.S Senator Buckingham ([[Burt Reynolds]]). The first part of his plan is to send Steve to the private school where Buckingham's daughter, Cookie, goes to (though Steve refuses to go, so Stan uses Roger). The second part is to meet Buckingham there and talks him into playing golf with him. Stan gets his favor, but then he is enraged that Roger sold Cookie to drug dealers. He gets her back, and he takes her back to Buckingham's house for dinner. Meanwhile, Steve is out of school because of an [[Asbestos]] outbreak, and after refusing to go to the private school, he joins a gang of Spanish girls. He is arrested for robbing a pharmacy, prompting Stan to use his favor to release him from jail. However, this causes Stan to frame a student from the private school for the armed robbery. He is seen riding away with John Q. Mind ([[Randy Spears]]) to have further adventures. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[License to Till]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|4|10}} | DirectedBy = John Aoshima & Jansen Yee | WrittenBy = Matt Fusfeld & Alex Cuthbertson | ProdCode = 6AJN04 | Aux4 = 3.35{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/04/12/sunday-final-ratings-celebrity-apprentice-secret-millionaire-adjusted-up-plus-unscrambled-cbs-ratings/89058|title=Sunday Final Ratings: 'Celebrity Apprentice,' 'Secret Millionaire' Adjusted Up; Plus Unscrambled CBS Ratings|last=Gorman|first=Bill|work=TV by the Numbers|date=April 12, 2011|accessdate=April 18, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 111 | EpisodeNumber2 = 15 | ShortSummary = Roger and Klaus try unsuccessfully to bring Steve to a higher social level, after when they make a bet and Steve dreaming of being with the cool kids. This results in Steve driving Snot's uncle Solomon's tractor to a Taco King. However, Steve's glasses are knocked off and loses the cool kids. Meanwhile, Stan and Francine prank each other, which results in a draw. However, Stan gets Francine involved in his prank consisting of Chinese Food and a Midget. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[Jenny Fromdabloc]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|4|17}} | DirectedBy = Bob Bowen | WrittenBy = Laura McCreary | ProdCode = 6AJN08 | Aux4 = 4.74{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|title=Sunday Finals: 'Celebrity Apprentice,' 'Amazing Race,' 'Undercover Boss,' 'Extreme Makeover,' '60 Minutes' Adjusted Up|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/04/19/sunday-finals-celebrity-apprentice-amazing-race-undercover-boss-extreme-makeover-60-minutes-adjusted-up/89904|work=TV By the Numbers|accessdate=April 19, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 112 | EpisodeNumber2 = 16 | ShortSummary = Steve and Roger try to cheer up Snot after Hayley rejects him. Meanwhile, Stan tries to live like a man of the 1960s. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[Home Wrecker]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|5|8}} | DirectedBy = Joe Daniello | WrittenBy = Alan R. Cohen & Alan Freedland | ProdCode = 6AJN05 | Aux4 = 3.29{{cite web|last=Gorman|first=Bill|title=Sunday Final Ratings: 'Desperate Housewives,' 'Amazing Race,' 'American Dad,' 'Family Guy' Adjusted Up; 'Brothers & Sisters' Adjusted Down|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/05/10/sunday-final-ratings-desperate-housewives-amazing-race-american-dad-family-guy-adjusted-up-brothers-sisters-adjusted-down/92054/|work=TV By the Numbers|date=May 10, 2011|accessdate=May 10, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 113 | EpisodeNumber2 = 17 | ShortSummary = Stan and Francine divide the house disagreeing about how to decorate it. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[Flirting with Disaster (American Dad!)|Flirting with Disaster]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|5|15}} | DirectedBy = Pam Cooke | WrittenBy = Keith Heisler | ProdCode = 6AJN06 | Aux4 =3.89{{cite web|last=Seidman|first=Robert|title=TV Ratings Sunday: 'Survivor' Finale Trumps 'Desperate Housewives' Finale, Trump and Everything Else|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/05/16/tv-ratings-sunday-survivor-finale-trumps-desperate-housewives-finale-trump-and-everything-else/92678/|work=TV By the Numbers|date=May 16, 2011|accessdate=May 18, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 114 | EpisodeNumber2 = 18 | ShortSummary = Francine cramps Stan's style when she gets a job in his office. Lorraine takes Stan's advantage by throwing acid in Francine's face, resulting in Stan donating his "Thunderbutt". Meanwhile, Steve and Roger start a Birdhouse building business. | LineColor = FF6666 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of American Dad! episodes | Title = [[Gorillas in the Mist (American Dad!)|Gorillas in the Mist]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2011|5|22}} | DirectedBy = Chris Bennett | WrittenBy = Erik Durbin | ProdCode = 6AJN10 | Aux4 =3.57{{cite web|last=Gorman|first=Bill|title=Sunday Final Ratings: 'Billboard Music Awards,' 'Celebrity Apprentice,' 'Funniest Videos,' 'Family Guy,' 'American Dad,' '60 Minutes' Adjusted Up|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/05/24/sunday-final-ratings-billboard-music-awards-celebrity-apprentice-funniest-videos-family-guy-american-dad-60-minutes-adjusted-up/93754/|work=TV By the Numbers|date=May 24, 2011|accessdate=May 24, 2011}} | EpisodeNumber = 115 | EpisodeNumber2 = 19 | ShortSummary = Bonding with Steve at the zoo causes Stan to lose Steve in the gorilla cage. Steve later gets out and makes up the tests he missed.
